chemical.name: Mancozeb
chemical.description: Broad-spectrum fungicide effective against blight and leaf spot diseases.
chemical.application_steps: Mix 2.5g per liter of water and spray evenly on affected leaves. Apply early morning or evening. Repeat every 7-10 days.

organic.name: Neem Oil
organic.description: Natural antifungal agent that prevents further infection and controls fungal growth.
organic.application_steps: Dilute 5ml neem oil per liter of water. Add few drops of liquid soap as emulsifier. Spray early morning. Repeat weekly.

preventive_measures: Remove fallen leaves and plant debris regularly
Ensure good air circulation between plants
Water at soil level, avoid overhead irrigation
Use disease-free seeds and resistant varieties

chemical.name: Copper Oxychloride
chemical.description: Effective copper-based fungicide for controlling blight diseases in various crops.
chemical.application_steps: Mix 3g per liter of water. Spray thoroughly covering all plant parts. Apply at 10-day intervals.

organic.name: Baking Soda Solution
organic.description: Natural fungicide that creates alkaline environment inhibiting fungal growth.
organic.application_steps: Mix 1 tablespoon baking soda + 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in 4 liters water. Spray on affected areas weekly.

preventive_measures: Maintain proper spacing between plants for air circulation
Water plants at base, avoid wetting leaves
Remove and destroy infected plant debris
Apply mulch to prevent soil splash on leaves
Rotate crops yearly to break disease cycle

chemical.name: Sulfur-based Fungicide
chemical.description: Traditional and effective treatment for powdery mildew on various crops.
chemical.application_steps: Apply as dust or mix 2g per liter water. Spray when disease first appears. Repeat every 7-14 days.

organic.name: Milk Spray
organic.description: Milk proteins create hostile environment for powdery mildew fungi.
organic.application_steps: Mix 1 part milk with 9 parts water. Spray on leaves weekly as preventive or treatment measure.
organic.where_to_buy: Use regular cow milk from local dairy

chemical.name: Propiconazole
chemical.description: Systemic fungicide effective against rust diseases in cereals and other crops.
chemical.application_steps: Mix 1ml per liter of water. Apply at first sign of disease. Repeat after 15 days if needed.

organic.name: Garlic Extract
organic.description: Natural antifungal with sulfur compounds that inhibit rust fungi.
organic.application_steps: Crush 10 garlic cloves in 1 liter water. Let it steep overnight. Strain and spray on plants weekly.
organic.where_to_buy: Use fresh garlic from local market

chemical.name: Streptocycline
chemical.description: Antibiotic effective against bacterial diseases in plants.
chemical.application_steps: Mix 1g in 10 liters water. Spray on affected plants. Apply 2-3 times at 5-day intervals.

organic.name: Bordeaux Mixture
organic.description: Traditional organic copper-based bactericide and fungicide.
organic.application_steps: Mix 100g copper sulfate + 100g lime in 10 liters water. Spray on plants. Apply every 10-15 days.

chemical.name: Chlorothalonil
chemical.description: Broad-spectrum fungicide for blight control in tomatoes and potatoes.
chemical.application_steps: Mix 2ml per liter water. Start spraying when plants are established. Repeat every 7-10 days.

organic.name: Compost Tea
organic.application_steps: Steep well-aged compost in water for 3 days. Strain and spray on plants. Apply bi-weekly.

chemical.name: Metalaxyl + Mancozeb
chemical.description: Combination fungicide providing systemic and contact action against late blight.
chemical.application_steps: Mix 2.5g per liter water. Apply preventively or at disease onset. Repeat every 7-10 days.

organic.name: Copper Soap Fungicide
organic.description: Organic copper-based treatment safe for edible crops.
organic.application_steps: Mix according to product instructions. Spray every 7-10 days in humid conditions.

chemical.name: Carbendazim
chemical.description: Systemic fungicide effective against anthracnose in fruits and vegetables.
chemical.application_steps: Mix 1g per liter water. Spray at flowering and fruit development stages. Repeat at 15-day intervals.

organic.name: Potassium Bicarbonate
organic.description: Natural fungicide that disrupts fungal cell walls.
organic.application_steps: Mix 2 tablespoons per liter water with few drops of soap. Spray weekly on affected plants.

chemical.name: Imidacloprid
chemical.description: Systemic insecticide to control virus-spreading insects like aphids and whiteflies.
chemical.application_steps: Mix 0.5ml per liter water. Spray to control vector insects. Remove and destroy infected plants.

organic.name: Neem Oil + Insecticidal Soap
organic.description: Controls virus-spreading insects naturally. Virus itself cannot be cured.
organic.application_steps: Mix 5ml neem oil + 5ml insecticidal soap per liter water. Spray to control aphids. Remove infected plants.

chemical.name: Preventive NPK Fertilizer
chemical.description: Balanced nutrition to maintain plant health and disease resistance.
chemical.application_steps: Apply NPK 19:19:19 at 5g per liter water every 15 days as foliar spray or soil application.

organic.name: Vermicompost
organic.description: Rich organic fertilizer improving soil health and plant immunity.
organic.application_steps: Apply 100-200g around plant base monthly. Mix well with soil and water.

chemical.name: Consult Agricultural Expert
chemical.description: Disease detected but specific treatment not in database. Please consult with local agricultural officer for proper diagnosis and treatment.
chemical.application_steps: Visit nearest Krishi Vigyan Kendra (KVK) or agricultural extension office with plant samples.
chemical.where_to_buy: Local agricultural input dealer or cooperative

organic.name: General Neem Oil Treatment
organic.description: Broad-spectrum organic pesticide effective against various plant diseases and pests.
organic.application_steps: Dilute 5ml neem oil per liter water. Add few drops liquid soap. Spray every 7-10 days on affected plants.

preventive_measures: Maintain proper plant spacing for air circulation
Water plants at base, avoid wetting foliage
Remove and destroy infected plant parts
Keep garden area clean and weed-free
Apply organic mulch to suppress soil-borne diseases
